TransE module¶

class Models.TransE.TransE(ent_total, rel_total, dims, norm=2)¶

Bases: Models.Model.Model

TransE [BUGD+13] is a representative relational distance model. All the embeddings, entities and relations are both represented in the same space \(\mathbb{R}^{d}\) where d is the dimension of the embedding. Given a triple (head, relation, tail), transE imposes the constraint that \(h+r \approx t\). The scoring function for TransE is defined as

\(f_{r}(h,t) = -||\mathbf{h}+\mathbf{r}-\mathbf{t}||_{1/2}\)

TransE enforces additional constraints \(||\mathbf{h}||_{2} = 1\) and \(||\mathbf{t}||_{2} = 1\).

__init__(ent_total, rel_total, dims, norm=2)¶
Parameters

  • ent_total (int) – Total number of entities

  • rel_total (int) – Total number of relations

  • dims (int) – Number of dimensions for embeddings

  • norm (int) – L1 or L2 norm. Default: 2

forward(data)¶

Calculate the scores for the given batch of triples

Parameters

data (Tensor) – Tensor containing the batch of triples for which scores are to be calculated

Returns

Tensor containing the scores for each triple

Return type

score (Tensor)

normalize()¶

Implement normalizations for parameters of the model

Calculate the scores for a given batch of triples during evaluation

Parameters

data (Tensor) – Tensor containing the batch of triples for which scores are to be calculated

Returns

Return type
